Detailed Description

Author:
Brecht Verstichel
Date:
23-02-2010

This class, SUP_PQG is a blockmatrix over the carrierspace's of the P, Q and G conditions. It inherits form its motherclass SUP_PQ. This class will expand its mother by a pointer to a PHM object (which is independent of the TPM objects, by which I mean that PHM::G( SUP_PQG::tpm (0)) is not neccesarily equal to SUP_PQG::phm()), and it will also redefine its mothers functions to include the PHM contribution.

Definition at line 22 of file SUP_PQG.h.

Copy constructor, allocates an extra PHM matrix in the pointer SZ_ph on top of the copy constructor of SUP_PQ with input SZ_c. SZ_c.phm() is copied into SZ_ph

void SUP_PQG::fill ( TPM &  tpm  ) 

Fill the SUP_PQG with TPM tpm, is defined as the SUP_PQ::fill function and adds:

SZ_ph = PHM::G (tpm)

void SUP_PQG::L_map ( SUP_PQG &  map,
SUP_PQG &  object 
)

Multiply symmetric SUP_PQG blockmatrix object left en right with symmetric SUP_PQG blockmatrix map to form another symmetric SUP_PQG matrix and put it in (*this): this = map*object*map

Parameters:
map SUP_PQG that will be multiplied to the left en to the right of matrix object
object central SUP_PQG

SUP_PQG & SUP_PQG::operator= ( double &  a  ) 

overload operator = number, all the blockmatrices in SUP are put equal to the number a. e.g. SZ = 0 makes all the Matrix elements zero.

Parameters:
a the number

Friends And Related Function Documentation

ostream& operator<< ( ostream &  output,
SUP_PQG &  sup_p 
) [friend]

Output stream operator overloaded, the usage is simple, if you want to print to a file, make an ifstream object and type:

object << sup_p << endl;

For output onto the screen type:

cout << sup_p << endl;

Parameters:
output The stream to which you are writing (e.g. cout)
sup_p the SUP you want to print
